name: 王正豪
objective:
Operating systems are an essential part of a computer system. In this course, we are going to introduce the fundamental concepts of modern operating systems. The topics can be divided into five major parts:
1. Process Management
2. Synchronization 
3. Memory Management 
4. Storage Management
5. File System
In addition to theoretical introduction, students are required to complete homework and programming exercises, as well as term projects for hands-on experiences of major operating system modules.
